subject: AI & Agents
title: AI and Misinformation at Scale
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on AI and Misinformation at Scale.

hook.text: AI can generate a thousand fake news articles in the time it takes a journalist to write one real one.

buildup.text: Language models make mass-producing convincing misinformation trivially easy.

discovery.text: Fake articles, reviews, social media posts, and even scientific abstracts can be auto-generated.

twist.text: Detecting AI-generated text is unreliable. Detectors have high false-positive rates.

climax.text: The information ecosystem may shift from 'is this true?' to 'who published this?'

punchline.text: When everything can be faked, trust becomes the real currency.

quiz.question: Why is AI-generated misinformation hard to combat?
options: AI text detectors have high false-positive rates
AI can only produce obviously fake content
Nobody is trying to detect it
